page.title: 09The A.38 Plympton St.Mary.
page.content: This road was opened in the mid'70s to relieve congestion through small villages.Until then Plymouth was poorly served with decent main roads. It provides the{main artery for } {traffic}from West Devon and Cornwall, to Exeter,Bristol,London,The Midlands and beyond. It has had{profound effects on farms {and farming,}splitting them or making them uneconomic by swallowing up valuable agricultural land. However because of the ease of travel a{small restaurant}has been set up at the Smithaleigh Flyover and the local farm has seen fit to erect a{small {motel. The road is often packed solid with cars or caravans during the summer months as the{tourists}flock to Cornwall or the Roscoff Ferry.
